role.descr: lost component, cut out component // intron, exon, or more than one of them //
location refering to organelle, cell or tissue

example.text: CD1c has a duplicated form of this exon that is thought to be spliced out.
example.arg: a duplicated form of this exon

example.text: Failure to splice out this intron resulted in a substitution of the final 13 amino acids of the deduced amino acid sequence.

In the remaining allelic p53 gene, there was a single-base substitution of G to T at position 1 within the splice donor site of intron 7, and the mutated intron was not spliced out during the mRNA maturation process.
It was observed that the cell lines differed in their ability to splice out a retained intron in the 5 UTR of HYAL1 mRNA.
Moreover, exon 16 can be spliced out from the mature transcripts that contain exons 15 to 24.
The failure to splice out putative intron sequences in transcripts which spanned exon-intron boundaries is expected in antisense transcripts.
This isoform results from a failure to splice out an intron during mRNA processing.
Three of the revertants obtained from the null allele unc-68(e540), which displayed normal motility, had intragenic mutations that resulted in failure to splice out intron 21.

Virtually all genes of higher organisms have non-coding introns interspersed between the coding exons that must be spliced out in order to generate a mature messenger RNA molecule used to encode proteins.
example.arg: a mature messenger RNA molecule used to encode proteins

example.text: We have shown that in the human, as in the chicken, one exon is spliced out of the MLC3nm transcript in smooth muscle to give an alternative product.
